item.title: Report E-2023100335
item.description:
Report E-2023100335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN3267 Super Strip Plus release 4 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to the cardboard packaging only. The boxes were crushed as a result of a load shift, causing the material to release from the jug lids. The damaged jugs were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100303
item.description:
Report E-2023100303

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia driver initially picked up the drum in question on 9/5/2023 from the offeror and the trailer was used to pick up other materials on 9/12/23. The driver noticed that there was some liquid on the front of the trailer along with oily stains on the back of the trailer. Veolia personnel started to remove the drums from the trailer and identified the leaking drum which was located at the nose of the trailer. The leaking drum was a 55 gal metal drum with a pin hole leak that appeared to occur from potentially rubbing/impact against another drum during transportation which was a weak spot due to corrosion. The driver made multiple stops that day and he has stated that he did not notice any staining on the back-end of the trailer when he loaded addition drums at each stop. Also he did not notice any oily material near or around the front of the trailer during those stops. We are unsure of the duration of the spill but based on the quantity still left in the drum, roughly 5 gallons had leaked out. The drum was placed into a salvage drum and the spill clean up was completed by the Veolia in-house crew. Most of the material was contained inside the trailer with minimal amounts outside of the trailer. There was no evidence of a any spill on the ground itself.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one of the metal 3 gallon cans of adhesive(un1133) had fallen and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090646
item.description:
Report X-2023090646

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed Haz package was wet and informed Management right away. Management placed leaky package inside a tote with absorbent. QA was then called to come collect the Haz package to process. DescribePack: The top cap of the bottle broke off and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a tote with absorbent to prevent leak from spreading. Package and cleanup absorbent was then placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent. Bag was then placed inside a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090630
item.description:
Report X-2023090630

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed package was wet and leaking, and informed Management right away. Manager used abosrbent to stop leak from spreading and informed QA-admin. QA-Admin came and placed leaky hazmat and cleanup material into a hazmat bag with absorbent, and placed bag inside a hazmat tote. DescribePack: The plastic bag inner packaging got a hole on the top and caused package to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to stop the leak from spreading, and used to clean up the spill. Package and cleanup material was then placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and the bag was placed inside a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090174
item.description:
Report X-2023090174

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TILX 160815 was reported to be leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). An estimated 2 ounces of product leaked from the BOV nozzle threads and cap. The cap was less then tool tight, adding Teflon tape to the threads and tightening the cap stopped the release. The BOV was in the closed position. Product in the nozzle was residue from off-loading operations. The shipper's facility is next the location of release. The shipper will route the car back to their facility and preform an additional inspection.

item.title: Report I-2023090145
item.description:
Report I-2023090145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: La Habra
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPS DRIVER PICKED UP PACKAGE FROM CUSTOMER LOCATION, AS DRIVER WAS COMING DOWN EAST PARKWOOD AVE TO MAKE HIS NEXT DELIVERY, HE BEGAN TO SMELL SOMETHING BURNING SO HE PULLED OVER. DRIVER OPENED THE BULKHEAD DOOR AND SAW BACK OF HIS CR FULL SMOKE SO HE JUMPED OUT. LEFT THE BULKHEAD DOOR OPEN AND CALLED THE SUPERVISOR TO NOTIFY HIM OF THE INCIDENT. SUPERVISOR FOLLOWED CHAIN OF COMMAND. MANAGER CALLED 911. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED. 1500 THE FIRE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED SHORTLY AFTER AND REMOVE SMOKING PACKAGE FROM PACKAGE CAR. AT THIS TIME, THEY BEGAN TO DO EMERGENCY MITIGATION BY SPRAYING WATER ONTO THE PACKAGE TO BRING DOWN THE TEMPERATURE AROUND 15:30, AT 17:50 THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER "PATRIOT ENVIRONMENTAL" ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AND THE FIRE DEPARTMENT STOP PUTTING WATER ON THE PACKAGE. THEY PUT SAND ON THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE AND BEGAN BREAKING THE CONTENTS TO REMOVE THE BATTERIES.FROM THIS POINT THEY MONITORED THE TEMPERATURES OF THE PACKAGE TO ENSURE THEY WERE DROPPING. TEMPERATURE WAS STILL UNSTABLE FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. AROUND 20:00 THE TEMPERATURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS STABLE ENOUGH AND THEY WERE GOING TO START THE PROCESS OF CLEANING UP AND PROCESSING THE CONTENTS OF THE SPILL .OUTSIDE RESPONDER TOOK ALL CONTENTS.

item.title: Report I-2023090144
item.description:
Report I-2023090144

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On American Airlines Flight 2468 the customer reported to the Flight Attendants that his 6 month old iPad Pro was becoming very hot and he was worried it would evolve into a thermal runaway. Flight Attendants and customer tried to cool the device but to no avail. Flight Attendants placed the iPad in the fire containment bag with 5 Iiters of water. Event consumed 45 minutes of flight time before iPad was deemed cooled.

  • Description: Man way swing bolts identified as loose-4 total and a deteriorated man way gasket was also identified during the inspection securement that would not allow compression once secured. The man way gasket was replaced and swing bolts secured with the car being spotted to an accessible track for exterior decon.
